alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 12:26PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Marion County through 115 PM EDT... At 1225 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Lake Weir, or 10 miles northwest of Wildwood, moving north at 10 mph. Another storm was near Stokes Ferry drifting north. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Belleview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
